meanings.definition: Capable of being proven true or accurate.
meanings.sent1: The scientist conducted experiments to find verifiable evidence.
meanings.sent2: It is important to have verifiable information before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a verifiable clue that led to solving the case.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a verifiable sign of happiness.
meanings.sent5: The teacher provided verifiable examples to support the lesson.

meanings.definition: Able to be confirmed or substantiated.
meanings.sent1: The witness testimony was not verifiable and lacked credibility.
meanings.sent2: The data needs to be verifiable through multiple sources.
meanings.sent3: The rumor about aliens visiting Earth was not verifiable.
meanings.sent4: His alibi was as verifiable as a fingerprint at a crime scene.
meanings.sent5: The authenticity of the painting was verifiable through expert analysis.
